alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:50AM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Assabet River At Maynard affecting Worcester and Middlesex Counties. Shawsheen River Near Wilmington affecting Essex and Middlesex Counties. Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. For the Assabet River...including Maynard...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Wilmington, Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Assabet River at Maynard. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding is likely in low lying sections along the river including portions of Maynard, Hudson and Concord. Water may approach homes along the river and may force several localized road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 5.6 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.6 feet on 12/13/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
